overview:
Kevin is a technology entrepreneur and investor.

He founded Cardinal Venture Partners, a seed stage fund, in 2007 and began learning about investing in early-stage technology companies and working with entrepreneurs the way an entrepreneur should â€“ by jumping in and doing it. Kevin’s beginnings in the technology industry was with Nexopia.com, Canadaâ€™s largest youth social network, after spending a decade in agriculture with the family apiary - one of Canada’s largest commercial honey producers. Kevin serves as the President & CEO of Nexopia as the company begins to venture into building products in other areas of social media.

Recently, Kevin was named a Venture Partner with iNovia Capital and has begun working with their talented team of venture capitalists that share the same passion for entrepreneurship and building successful technology companies. Kevin completed a BSc. in Mechanical Engineering at the University of Alberta and a MS in Mechanical Engineering at Stanford University concentrating on control systems, dynamics, mechatronics and entrepreneurship.
